Training Officer Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Training Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The L&D Officer plays a key role in delivering learning initiatives across the organization, ensuring compliance with training requirements, and providing effective logistical and administrative support for training programmers.


Key Duties and Responsibilites


	Prepare and dispatch training invitations to participants of approved programmers.
	Obtain statutory approvals from Industrial Training Fund (ITF) for approved programmers.
	Maintain accurate records and filing of all training documents and activities.
	Prepare and submit weekly and monthly training activity reports to the L&D Manager.
	Provide logistical support for effective delivery of approved training programmers.
	Maintain proper attendance and conduct end-of-training assessments for all programmes.
	Prepare cost implications for training activities involving travel.
	Process vendor payments for training-related services.
	Upload and process all scheduled training programmers on SharePoint for management approval.
	Record staff training data in the training monitor template.
	Process annual ITF reimbursement filing with the ITF consultant.
	Support the implementation of the company’s e-learning strategy.
	Perform any other tasks assigned by the L&D Manager or senior management.


Requirements
Formal Education:


	Degree in Management, Social Sciences, Education, IT, Psychology, Statistics, Business Management, or related fields.


Work Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Experience in designing and delivering training (e.g. in Health & Safety, IT, Technical, and Management Development).


Skills and Behaviours:


	Strong facilitation and coaching skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Effective personal and time management.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
	Ability to work under pressure.
	Integrity, teamwork, and proactive problem-solving.


Professional Qualifications:


	Relevant competency certification(s) in Training, HR, or related field (e.g., CIPM, CIPD, SHRM, Learning & Development certifications).

Human Resource Officer Job at Officemakers International Limited




        
    

        
        Officemakers International Limited specializes in providing tailored recruitment solutions in Graduate and Professional Recruitment, Executive Search & Selection, Non Executive Recruitment, Background Checks and lots more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer
Job Location: Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

            
    




	Managing the full employee lifecycle, focusing on recruiting licensed agents, onboarding them, ensuring compliance with real estate laws, developing performance systems for sales, handling employee relations for high-pressure roles, and implementing training for market knowledge and ethics, all while managing budgets, HRIS, and strategic workforce planning for sales, leasing, and property management teams.


Key Responsibilities


	Key skills include labor law knowledge, strong negotiation, data analysis, leadership, and confidentiality.


Requirements


	HND / BSc in HR, Business Administration, or related field.
	3–5 years of HR experience (experience in the real estate sector is an advantage).
	Strong communication, organisational, and interpersonal skills.
	Knowledge of labour laws and HR best practices.
	Must be a female.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 + Benefits.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@officemakersng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

        Wale University is an Open and Distance Learning institution committed to transforming education across Africa through innovation, real-world learning, and Christ-centered leadership. Our programs are designed to equip students with practical skills, entrepreneurial thinking, and globally relevant competencies to solve problems and create value.

	Design and develop structured AI course curricula (live and pre-recorded)
	Deliver engaging live teaching sessions, tutorials, and discussions
	Create high-quality instructional materials, assignments, and assessments

	Support learners through mentorship, feedback, and academic guidance
	Collaborate with Wale University’s academic and program teams to ensure quality and relevance

	Demonstrated expertise in at least one listed AI domain with practical or research-based experience
	Academic or professional background in AI, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Law, Business, or related fields

	Strong ability to simplify and explain complex AI concepts
	Familiarity with modern AI tools, platforms, and workflows relevant to the specialization
	Experience creating educational content (lectures, workshops, recordings, or documentation)
	Excellent communication skills and ability to engage diverse, global learner audiences
	Self-driven, organized, and effective in a remote, asynchronous teaching environment
